options.c: To facilitate communication with hardware devices

questions.question: Which type of memory is non-volatile and retains its data even when the power is turned off?
Which option is used with the chmod command to add execute permission for the owner?
A cache memory has an access time of 15 ns, while main memory access takes 100 ns. If 80% of accesses are cache hits, what is the effective memory access time?
In a 4-stage pipeline, each stage takes 5 ns to complete. If there is a 1-cycle delay due to branch instructions, what is the time required to execute 50 instructions?
Which command is used to navigate to the home directory?
What is the size of the TLB tag if a CPU generates 36-bit virtual addresses, the page size is 4 KB, and the TLB has 512 entries?

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int a = 2, b = 2;
    a = a++ + a++;
    b = b++ + ++b;
    printf("%d %d\n", a, b);
    return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
    int a = 0, b = 1, c = 2;
    if (a++ && ++b || ++c) {
        printf("%d %d %d\n", a, b, c);
    } else {
        printf("%d %d %d\n", a, b, c);
    }
    return 0;
}

What is the output of this C code?
int main() {
    int a = 2, b = 3, c = 4;
    a = b = c;
    printf("%d %d %d", a, b, c);
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
        if (i % 3 == 0 && i != 0) {
            break;
        }
        printf("%d ", i);
    }
    return 0;
}

Consider the following code:

int main() {
    char ch = '0';
    printf("%d\n", ch);
    return 0;
}
What is the output?

What will be printed by the following code?
int main() {
    int a = 10;
    while (a-- > 5)
        printf("%d ", a);
}

What is the output of the following code?

enum numbers {ONE = 1, TWO, THREE, FOUR = 10, FIVE};
int main() {
    printf("%d %d %d %d %d\n", ONE, TWO, THREE, FOUR, FIVE);
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following program?

void main() {
    int a = 5, b = 7;
    printf("%d", a+++b);
}

Consider the following code:


int main() {
    int *ptr = (int *)calloc(5, sizeof(int));
    if (ptr == NULL) {
        printf("Memory not allocated\n");
        return 1;
    }
    for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
        printf("%d ", ptr[i]);
    }
    free(ptr);
    return 0;
}
What is the output?
What does the command 'ls -l' do?

options.a: List all files in the current directory.
options.c: List all files in long format.

questions.question:
Given the code below, which function will be called?

using namespace std;
void func(int a) {
    cout << "func(int)" << endl;
}
void func(double a) {
    cout << "func(double)" << endl;
}
void func(float a) {
    cout << "func(float)" << endl;
}
int main() {
    func('A');
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
template 
class Test {
public:
    static int count;
    Test() { count++; }
};
template 
int Test::count = 0;
int main() {
    Test obj1, obj2;
    Test obj3;
    cout << Test::count << " " << Test::count << endl;
    return 0;
}

Consider the following code. What will be the output?

using namespace std;

struct Node {
    int data;
    Node* next;
    Node(int d) : data(d), next(nullptr) {}
};

int main() {
    Node a(1);
    Node b(2);
    a.next = &b;
    cout << a.next->data << endl;
    return 0;
}
Which operator cannot be overloaded?

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;

void func() {
    static int x = 0;
    x++;
    cout << x << " ";
}

int main() {
    for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
        func();
    }
    return 0;
}
Which among the following have least security according to the access permissions allowed?

What is the output of this program?

using namespace std;

int add(int& x, int& y) {
    x++;
    y++;
    return x + y;
}

int main() {
    int a = 3, b = 4;
    cout << add(a, b) << endl;
    cout << a << " " << b << endl;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of this program?

using namespace std;

class MyClass {
    int x;
public:
    MyClass(int a) : x(a) {}
    friend void modify(MyClass& obj);
};

void modify(MyClass& obj) {
    obj.x = 10;
}

int main() {
    MyClass obj(5);
    modify(obj);
    cout << obj.x << endl;
    return 0;
}

What is the output of this program?

using namespace std;

class Base {
public:
    virtual void display() {
        cout << "Base display" << endl;
    }
};

class Derived : public Base {
public:
    void display() {
        cout << "Derived display" << endl;
    }
};

int main() {
    Derived obj;
    obj.display();
    return 0;
}

options.a: Splitting a table into multiple tables to reduce redundancy.
options.b: Combining multiple tables into a single table to improve performance.
options.c: Ensuring all attributes are fully dependent on the primary key.
options.d: Creating indexes to speed up queries.

questions.question: If a database transaction is said to be "isolated," what does it mean?

options.b: It does not interfere with other transactions.
options.c: It runs in a separate database.
options.d: It is performed without any locks.
